definition[0]: if something is on hold, it is going to be done or dealt with at a later date rather than now
example[0]: The plans are on hold until after the election.
example[1]: Since having the kids, my career has been put on hold.
definition[1]: if you are on hold, you are waiting to talk to someone on the telephone
example[2]: We try not to keep people on hold for more than a couple of minutes.
example[3]: The agent put me on hold while she consulted a colleague.
